arts.ttl: Doku, Grealish, Dias - Man City injury latest and return dates as Pep Guardiola dealt fresh setback
arts.sum: Manchester City injury list as Jeremy Doku adds to the concerns

arts.ttl: Pep Guardiola's pre-match decision and full time row creates further Man City intrigue
arts.sum: Pep Guardiola altered his pre-match routine at Brighton

arts.ttl: Why Man City were 'too easy to play through' against Brighton
arts.sum: Match of the Day's Alan Shearer and Micah Richards look at how Brighton's brilliant second-half performance gave them a 2-1 win over Manchester City.

arts.ttl: FPL long view: Plan ahead for Chelsea and Brighton's kind fixtures
arts.sum: The Scout helps managers in Fantasy Premier League plan ahead by highlighting clubs with good fixtures around the corner from Gameweek 12 onwards. According to the Fixture Difficulty Ratings (FDR), as many as nine of Chelsea’s 11 matches from Gameweek 12 onwards score only two.

arts.ttl: Man United transfer news: Ruben Amorim planning shock swoop for ex-Man City star?
arts.sum: Incoming Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim is reportedly interested in bringing Juventus defender and ex-Manchester City man Danilo to Old Trafford.

arts.ttl: Kyle Walker demands Manchester City's 'real characters' to come to the fore and insists the club will 'weather the storm' in a blunt message after a FOURTH straight defeat left Pep Guardiola's side adrift in the title race
arts.sum: Pep Guardiola saw his side give up a one-goal advantage for the second time in a week at the Amex, as the Seagulls' secured a famous 2-1 win to deal a major blow to their title hopes.

arts.ttl: Is it beginning of the end for Guardiola's Man City dynasty?
arts.sum: Is Pep Guardiola facing his biggest test at Manchester City after a fourth successive defeat at Brighton?

arts.ttl: Real Madrid’s TRIPLE injury blow, Man City RECORD defeat, Chelsea’s Kepa LOSS
arts.sum: Real Madrid ’s transfer plans for January have changed after they were rocked by a fresh injury blow, Manchester City have slipped further off the Premier League pace behind Liverpool and Chelsea are bracing themselves for a huge loss. As a result, Real Madrid are set to make moves in the January transfer window, with Fabrizio Romano confirming their interest in Trent Alexander-Arnold of Liverpool and Castello Lukeba of RB Leipzig.

arts.ttl: Guardiola faces his biggest Man City challenge yet
arts.sum: Pep Guardiola walked into his press conference after Manchester City's 2-1 defeat at Brighton and was asked if he now faces his biggest challenge at the club.

arts.ttl: Why Pep Guardiola proteges Mikel Arteta and Enzo Maresca will NOT replace him at Manchester City, writes DANNY MURPHY
arts.sum: It's a massive compliment to Pep Guardiola that two of the brightest Premier League managers worked for him at Manchester City and have greatly improved Chelsea and Arsenal on what they learned.
